definitions: the removal or obliteration of written or printed matter, especially by drawing a line through it

examples.text: we can agree on the deletion of the second paragraph
deletions from the list could only be made after debate

definitions: the removal of data from a computer's memory

examples.text: a bug is responsible for the unexplained deletion of emails
it pays to ensure deletion of unnecessary files

shortDefinitions: removal of data from computer's memory

definitions: the removal of a product, especially a recording, from the catalog of those available for purchase.
shortDefinitions: removal of product from catalogue of those available for purchase

definitions: the loss or excision of a section of genetic code, or its product, from a nucleic acid or protein sequence

examples.text: deletion of the gene in mice results in a very reduced tail
his team has identified several types of deletions of chromosome 1

shortDefinitions: loss or excision of section of genetic code, or its product, from nucleic acid or protein sequence
